Newton''s method cycle
Finding a simple %s for F=2+X*(-2+X*X).\n
A simple cycle of Newton''s method is when after two steps
the iterative vector is back to the starting point
The solution %g is stationary, so also a cycle point. \n
One pair of cycle points is %g abd %g \n
The other pair of cycle points is %g abd %g \n
There are also two other pairs, complex conjugate, not diplayed here.
Let us verify the first pair of cycle points by actual calculations.
A scalar example, F=2+X*(-2+X*X); X0=1; resulting in a cycle
